learning_outcomes.description: Understand and employ perturbation theory in a variety of situations.
Formulate and analyse basic models of traffic flow and shock formation.
Solve and analyse 1D models for continuum mechanics.
Formulate and analyse continuum models in higher dimensions.

assessments.task_description: The end of semester examination in this course will be held during the end-of-semester examination period. It will be an in-person exam held on campus.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.task_description: Demonstrate your knowledge of the course material on selected problems.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Assignments can be downloaded from the Blackboard web site. Please submit your assignment through Blackboard before the due date.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 1 To Week 13(28 Jul - 02 Nov)
learning_activities.topic:
Lectures

There are three hours of lectures per week. The lectures define the course material. They set out the basic theory and demonstrate techniques for problem solving. They cover all the core material required for the course and are also used to provide administrative information for the course.

They set out the basic theory and demonstrate techniques for problem solving. They cover all the core material required for the course and are also used to provide administrative information for the course.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 2 To Week 13(04 Aug - 02 Nov)
learning_activities.topic:
Applied classes

Applied classes provide students with individual assistance. Solutions to class problems will be presented.
